bwwExcerpt: "The film is strongest when it remembers it’s a Tim Burton film and has licence to get weird. While it’s slicker and less homemade-feeling than the 1988 vintage, there are still flashes of B-movie brilliance." Sophie
rejectionReasoning: claude: This is a film review of a Tim Burton movie from 1988, not a Broadway theater review; kimi: This text is a review of the 'Beetlejuice' film (likely the 2024 sequel), not the Broadway musical.
